energyActions.title: Thermostat Settings
energyActions.text: Turn down your thermostat when you leave the house
energyActions.text_3rdPerson: Turn down your thermostat when you leave the house
energyActions.text_1stPerson: I turned down my thermostat to 20 C when i left the house today
energyActions.fact: Each degree you lower your thermostat in the winter can save the planet as much as 661 pounds of CO2

energyActions.title: Thermostat in Summer
energyActions.text: In summer, turn your thermostat to 78 or above - use a fan
energyActions.text_3rdPerson: In summer, turn your thermostat up to 78˚
energyActions.text_1stPerson: I turned my thermostat up to 78˚for the summer
energyActions.fact: Raising the temperature 2° F can drop CO2 emissions by 242 lbs.

energyActions.title: Cold Water
energyActions.text: Wash 1 load of clothes in cold water
energyActions.text_1stPerson: I washed my clothes in cold water Energy
energyActions.fact: Almost 90% of the energy consumed by a washing machine goes to heating water.

energyActions.title: Bulbs
energyActions.text: Replace your light bulbs with LED
energyActions.text_3rdPerson: Replace your light bulbs with LED
energyActions.text_1stPerson: I replaced my light bulbs with LED Energy
energyActions.fact: Electricity used for artificial lighting in the U.S.could be cut nearly in half by 2030 through the adoption of high efficiency LEDs.

energyActions.title: Electronics
energyActions.text: Put electronics on power strips and turn off when not in use.
energyActions.text_3rdPerson: Use powers strips to turn off idle appliances
energyActions.fact: Using a power strip to turn off electronics and appliances when they aren't in use ensures that they are truly off and not using extra electricity.

energyActions.title: Water Heater
energyActions.text: Set the water heater temperature at 120 degrees
energyActions.text_3rdPerson: Set the water heater temperature at 120˚ F
energyActions.text_1stPerson: I set the water heater at 120˚ F
energyActions.fact: 18 % of the average home’ s energy bill comes from the energy needed to heat water.(EPA)

energyActions.title: Line Dry
energyActions.text: Line dry your clothes indoors or outdoors
energyActions.fact: One dryer load uses 5 times more electricity than washing– by simply line - drying your clothes, you can save 1 / 3 of their carbon footprint

energyActions.title: Lights
energyActions.text: Turn off your lights whenever not needed
